+0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/608eb62d34af8d001859a770?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"4a2b6d49c3e4a02c2a7af39e5595017a","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn81@2020_4/2021/05/03/03-57-21-683_a81d49cb8b628b3d.webp","destWidth":2666,"destHeight":2000,"sourceBytes":162692,"destBytes":162692,"author":"bwinck@businessinsider.com (Ben Winck)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/608eb63bf22c6b00185db292?format=jpeg":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn24@2020_5/2021/05/03/03-57-26-516_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=SHWHaziE8Tg:Nx2K5YzLJMg:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn44@2020_2/2021/05/03/03-57-23-700_db43c98492c85777.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=SHWHaziE8Tg:Nx2K5YzLJMg:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn84@2020_5/2021/05/03/03-57-25-149_f772057df42a7c35.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn68@2020_4/2021/05/03/03-57-24-468_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=SHWHaziE8Tg:Nx2K5YzLJMg:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn55@2020_4/2021/05/03/03-57-26-240_deeb999bf45b1260.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/SHWHaziE8Tg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn97@2020_4/2021/05/03/03-57-22-722_aa13e5ac0f6cd9a8.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1620014238428},{"createdTime":"2021-05-03 11:57:18","updatedTime":"2021-05-03 11:57:18","title":"A pilot and an architect try answering the Google job interview brain teaser","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/google-boeing-747-brain-teaser-pilot-architect-answer-2020-9","description":"<div style=\"position:relative; overflow:hidden; padding-bottom:56.25%\">\n<iframe src=\"https://cdn.jwplayer.com/players/wErUsYK4-jZbcmOYf.html\" width=\"100%\" height=\"100%\" style=\"position:absolute;\" allow=\"fullscreen\"></iframe>\n</div><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/s?q=tech+companies\">Tech companies</a> like <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/s?q=google\">Google </a>and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/s?q=facebook\">Facebook</a> have had a history of asking impossible questions during job interviews. </li>\n<li>We wanted to see how two experts in completely different fields would answer one such question.</li>\n<li>Pilot Anna Battison and architect Samantha Josephat both answered a brain teaser Google used to ask job candidates: How many golf balls fit into a Boeing 747? </li>\n<li>With their different professional backgrounds, the two experts approached the question in very different ways.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider&#39;s homepage for more stories.</a></li>\n</ul><p><em>Following is a transcript of the video.</em></p><p><strong>Anna Battison:</strong> Well, I hope that&#39;s accurate. I feel like I should maybe ask somebody.</p><p><strong>Samantha Josaphat:</strong> Um, wish me luck. </p><p><strong>Battison:</strong> So, how many golf balls can you fit in a Boeing 747? I... I have no idea.</p><p><strong>Josaphat:</strong> How many tennis balls? Oh, golf...wow. Wow. My first step is to dimension the size of a golf ball, which I actually don&#39;t know.</p><p><strong>Battison:</strong> A golf ball is, I don&#39;t know...</p><p><strong>Josaphat:</strong> I&#39;ve never played golf before.</p><p><strong>Battison:</strong> If you play tennis, a little bit smaller than a tennis ball. Josaphat: I&#39;m gonna predict that a golf ball is 4 inches by 4 inches in diameter.</p><p><strong>Battison:</strong> And a headrest is probably, I don&#39;t know. Here&#39;s my head. So let&#39;s say it&#39;s that big and maybe that thick. And now I&#39;m just trying to break down the seat to figure out how many golf balls are in it. So, in this headrest, there are about 15. I&#39;m gonna say that there are three rows of three headrests that can fit in the back portion of it. And then I&#39;m gonna say there&#39;s two rows of three for the bottom part. Then that gives us three, six, nine on the top, six on the bottom. 15 times 15 golf balls in each headrest. There are 15 headrests in the seat. That gives us 225 golf balls per seat.</p><p><strong>Josaphat:</strong> I&#39;m now attempting to draw a plane. I&#39;m such an architect. It&#39;s like, I gotta get it right. Oh, gosh! I&#39;m sorry. That looks horrible. Can I just line up my wings?</p><p><strong>Battison: </strong>This is very bad. So, you have the cabin, which is like, X1, X2 is, like, where the passenger goes with all the seats. Those are what the seats are. And then X3, which is, like, the undercarriage, which might be down here, and, you know, just where all the luggage goes.</p><p><strong>Josaphat:</strong> When I first think about the plane and plan, what is a variable that I can replicate numerous times? And that&#39;s the seat.</p><p><strong>Battison</strong><em>: </em>In a 747, primarily have two seats here, two seats here, an aisle, an aisle, and three seats in the middle. So that&#39;s seven seats across in each row.</p><p><strong>Josaphat:</strong> I will assume a Boeing 747 has about 80 rows.</p><p><strong>Battison:</strong> So if there are 366 seats, so 366 seats in a Boeing 747, that means that 366 divided by seven would be about 52 rows.</p><p><strong>Josaphat:</strong> Now, if I were to say a typical chair for a person is about 18 inches wide and a Boeing 747 has three aisles of seating with potentially four seats in the middle, three seats on either end, how many seats are in just one row?</p><p><strong>Battison:</strong> I&#39;m gonna add two seats per row because there&#39;s an aisle here where I can add a seat, hypothetically. So if I&#39;m adding two seats per row, that would give me 104 extra seats that I could fit in for that first layer across the bottom. There&#39;s 470 seats on the bottom layer times 225. That gives me 105,750 golf balls.</p><p><strong>Josaphat:</strong> So we have, six and four is 10. So we have 10 times 18. That gives us 180 inches. Then we multiply that by 80 rows. That&#39;s 14,400 inches. That&#39;d give me 1,200 feet. So now we would have to incorporate circulation.</p><p><strong> Battison:</strong> Now, you gotta think about, those golf balls are really small. I&#39;ve got so many gaps in between each seat.</p><p><strong>Josaphat:</strong> So, if I were to relate circulation to an airplane, that would mean the aisles that go from the front and the back of the plane, the space in between the seats so that everyone can get to their seat comfortably. Battison: I&#39;m gonna seriously ballpark this. So, across, I&#39;ve got seven seats. Let&#39;s say there are seven gaps where 100 golf balls can fit. That&#39;s seven gaps in each row. So seven times 52 rows is 364. So 364 times, let&#39;s say in each gap, 100 golf balls can fit, 36,400.</p><p><strong>Josaphat:</strong> And, like, a typical building, in New York City&#39;s Standard of Quality Housing, you need about 30% of circulation in a space. So what&#39;s 30% of 1,200 feet? That&#39;s 360 feet. That&#39;s 360...square feet. I just realized it&#39;s not just feet. 1,200 square feet plus 360 gives us 1,560 square feet. So that includes seats and circulation.</p><p><strong>Battison:</strong> So, now I&#39;m gonna picture how many layers of seats can I stack on top of each other in that gap in the cabin. I&#39;m gonna say maybe three rows, just &#39;cause the seats are high. So then I&#39;m gonna do that number times three, 317,250 golf balls. That&#39;s how many golf balls I have in three layers of seats. And that comes out as being 353,650.</p><p><strong>Josaphat:</strong> Now we have to think about the cockpit, where the pilot is, as well as areas for meal prep and the bathrooms.</p><p><strong>Battison: </strong>X2 is very big, right? It&#39;s, like, 52 rows plus the space on top. So I&#39;m gonna say there&#39;s, you know, gotta be at least 10 that&#39;ll fit in there. Now, maybe that&#39;s a little bit overestimating, but I think I underestimated for the amount of golf balls anyway. So let&#39;s just go with that.</p><p><strong>Josaphat:</strong> So, I&#39;m just gonna estimate 40%. &#39;Cause typically in a building, you have to think about, 40% of the space goes to infrastructure, like mechanical systems and plumbing.</p><p><strong>Battison:</strong> So if there are 353,650 golf balls that fit into the cabin, there would be 10 that fit in there, so that number divided by 10. That&#39;s gonna be 35,365.</p><p><strong>Josaphat:</strong> What&#39;s 40% of 1,560 square feet? So now we&#39;ll do 624 plus 1,560, and that&#39;ll get us 2,184. So now we have the floor plan covered. And now we have to think about it in volume.</p><p><strong>Battison</strong><em>: </em>The X3 is what we have left.</p><p><strong>Josaphat:</strong> Typical height in an apartment in New York could be around 8 to 10 feet high. And then the height of the carry-on luggage. So we&#39;ll say 11 feet head clearance, and then we&#39;ll add an additional two feet for the material of the plane. And so that&#39;s 13 feet height.</p><p><strong>Battison:</strong> I don&#39;t actually know exactly how big a 747 is, but I would imagine very, very big.</p><p><strong>Josaphat:</strong> Now, if we have to consider the space below where the baggage claim is, typically, someone can actually walk in that space to grab luggage.</p><p><strong>Battison:</strong> I would say that it&#39;s roughly the same size as the cabin or maybe even bigger.</p><p><strong>Josaphat:</strong> And so I will just double that height and make that 26 feet. Now I will multiply 26 feet by 2,184 square feet.</p><p><strong>Battison:</strong> The grand total is now 35,365 plus 353,650 plus 353 again, 650, equals 742,665. So that&#39;s our grand total for a 747 that does not actually have the 366 seats.</p><p><strong>Josaphat</strong><em>: </em>So, my last step would be to divide the total cubic feet of the plane by the cubic feet that I&#39;ve figured out for the golf ball.</p><p><strong>Battison:</strong> But if we have an airliner, we do have those seats that can&#39;t hold the golf balls.</p><p><strong>Josaphat:</strong> 56,784 cubic feet divided by 12 cubic feet. That total answer would be 4,732 golf balls<em>. </em></p><p><strong>Battison: </strong>If it has 366 seats, 366 seats times however many golf balls can fit into each seat, we said was 225. So 366 times 225 would give us 82,350.</p><p><strong>Josaphat</strong><em>: </em>That really does not feel real. I&#39;m not comfortable with that answer.</p><p><strong>Battison:</strong> So I&#39;m going to do this number minus this number to get our grand total for an airline 747. Gives us 660,315 golf balls.</p><p><strong>Josaphat:</strong> Oh, I know what the problem is. I did 12 cubic feet, not 12 cubic inches. So there&#39;s actually another step. That would be multiplying by 12. Oh, that&#39;s funny. Which would give me 56,784 golf balls. Final answer.</p><p><strong>Battison:</strong> I have a gut feeling that that&#39;s way too little.</p><p><strong>Josaphat:</strong> It may be a little bit low still. I mean, I&#39;m gonna have to trust the math at this point.</p><p><strong>Battison:</strong> I thought I would come out to a number that was maybe a million or so. I think I told you, a headrest is about, like, this big.</p><p><strong>Josaphat:</strong> So if I were to go back, I&#39;d probably tweak the size of the golf ball.</p><p><strong>Battison:</strong> I think far more than 15 golf balls can fit into there. Maybe more along the range of 25 or 30 golf balls. In aviation, they always want you to refer back to, you know, facts. You&#39;re always supposed to follow your checklist in an emergency. You&#39;re supposed to rely on your instruments.</p><p><strong>Josaphat</strong><em>: </em>It did bring back the inner third grade in me, where it&#39;s like, oh, you gotta stay up all night and figure out this math problem. Battison: Do you have an actual answer?</p><p><strong>Alex Appolonia:</strong> Well, not exactly. We found a lot of different answers to this brain teaser. But the whole point of these questions is to show how people think. Google no longer asks these brain teasers, because they don&#39;t predict how well someone would do at a job, but we wanted to have a little fun with it. Feel free to let us know in the comments below more brain teasers you would like to see solved, and make sure you subscribe to our channel, so you don&#39;t miss it.</p><p><em>EDITOR&#39;S NOTE: This video was originally published in October 2020.</em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/R5ECB3gNsTY\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 02 May 2021 12:39:20 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f6e16c3259a51001905f3e9?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"0d21f26320bd2fbda401b4af86f1c8f9","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn22@2020_6/2021/05/03/03-57-21-547_b5bb2b3ca9f78aa2.webp","destWidth":4176,"destHeight":3132,"sourceBytes":400238,"destBytes":400238,"author":"aappolonia@businessinsider.com (Alexandra Appolonia,Bobby Landergan)","articleImgCdnMap":{"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn24@2020_5/2021/05/03/03-57-26-516_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=R5ECB3gNsTY:a-lFpdWJIcU:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn26@2020_4/2021/05/03/03-57-25-187_4496f34e7a832a07.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=R5ECB3gNsTY:a-lFpdWJIcU:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn80@2020_3/2021/05/03/03-57-26-282_00266cf734ce9007.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn68@2020_4/2021/05/03/03-57-24-468_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=R5ECB3gNsTY:a-lFpdWJIcU:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn31@2020_2/2021/05/03/03-57-26-156_cf4e0950f7805a09.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/R5ECB3gNsTY":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn59@2020_5/2021/05/03/03-57-27-372_634216b1eebfc8b0.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1620014238435},{"createdTime":"2021-05-03 11:57:18","updatedTime":"2021-05-03 11:57:18","title":"'Maybe I just wasn't good enough': Elizabeth Warren reflects on unsuccessful presidential campaign in new book","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/elizabeth-warren-examination-2020-presidential-campaign-book-2021-5","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608ec508f22c6b00185db2a4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Elizabeth Warren\" height=\"2499\" width=\"5000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Then-US presidential candidate Elizabeth Warren speaks during a rally at Washington Square Park in New York on September 16, 2019.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Preston Ehrler/SOPA Images/LightRocket via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Sen. Warren reflects on her unsuccessful 2020 presidential bid in her upcoming book, &#34;Persist.&#34;</li>\n<li>After entering the race to much fanfare, she was unable to translate that enthusiasm to votes.</li>\n<li>&#34;Maybe I just wasn&#39;t good enough to reassure the voters,&#34; she wrote.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>When Sen. Elizabeth Warren of Massachusetts entered the 2020 presidential race, <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2011/11/20/magazine/heaven-is-a-place-called-elizabeth-warren.html\">she didn&#39;t really need</a> a national introduction.</p><p>A former professor at Harvard Law School, she was also the architect of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB), which was started under then-President Barack Obama in 2011 to oversee consumer protection in the financial sector.</p><p>After Warren was <a href=\"https://www.politico.com/story/2012/11/warren-wins-083441\">elected</a> to the Senate from Massachusetts in 2012, defeating then-GOP Sen. Scott Brown, the presidential buzz immediately followed.</p><p>When Warren <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/elizabeth-warren-president-announcement-2020-election-shes-officially-running-for-2019-2\">announced her candidacy</a> in February 2019, she was seen as a Democrat who could win progressives and blue-collar Democrats with her populist economic message. After many rural voters abandoned former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton during the 2016 presidential election, Warren felt that robust economic plans on tax reform and proposals for tackling student loan debt would resonate with a wide swath of voters.</p><p>However, after disappointing showings in <a href=\"https://www.wbur.org/news/2020/02/14/senator-elizabeth-warren-2020-uphill-battle\">Iowa</a>, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/warren-supporter-says-shes-done-after-poor-new-hampshire-results-2020-2\">New Hampshire</a>, and <a href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/2020/02/29/elizabeth-warren-south-carolina-118374\">South Carolina</a>, she tried to turn her campaign around on Super Tuesday. It didn&#39;t work.</p><p>After Biden <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/massachusetts-democratic-primary-live-results-vote-counts-2020-3\">unexpectedly won</a> the Massachusetts Democratic primary that day, with Warren securing a third-place finish in her home state, she soon exited the race.</p><p><strong><em>Read more: </em></strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/biden-executive-orders-abortion-gender-lgbtq-transgender-rights-trump-2021-1\"><em>Here&#39;s how Biden is reshaping gender and reproductive rights with policies that are even more progressive than past Democratic presidents</em></a></p><p>What happened?</p><p>In Warren&#39;s upcoming book, &#34;Persist,&#34; <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Persist-Elizabeth-Warren/dp/1250799244\">set to be released</a> on May 4, she reflects - quite candidly - on why her campaign failed to launch her into a one-on-one battle with former President Donald Trump for the White House.</p><p>&#34;In this moment, against this president, in this field of candidates, maybe I just wasn&#39;t good enough to reassure the voters, to bring along the doubters, to embolden the hopeful,&#34; Warren wrote.</p><p>She wrote that the possibility of this notion being true was &#34;painful.&#34;</p><p>For Warren, who has kept a somewhat low profile since Biden took office, the book reveals a chapter of her life that had the potential to make her the first female president in US history.</p><section><p data-el=\"text\">In the book, Warren points to questions about the cost of her health care overhaul as part of her downfall, as well as what she says were the lingering suspicions that plagued high-profile female candidates like 2010 Massachusetts Senate candidate Martha Coakley and Clinton.</p><p data-el=\"text\">&#34;I had to run against the shadows of Martha and Hillary,&#34; she said, suggesting that some voters may have been leery of nominating a woman to take on Trump.</p><p data-el=\"text\">Warren also said that with the dozens of policy proposals that were drafted during the campaign, there was a lot to juggle.</p><p data-el=\"text\">&#34;It can be risky to learn on the run, particularly if some of that learning is happening in public,&#34; she wrote.</p><p data-el=\"text\">While Warren takes time to tackle her loss in the book, as a sitting senator, she still wants to empower her ideas.</p><p data-el=\"text\">&#34;This book is about the fight that lies ahead,&#34; Warren emphasizes on the back of the book.</p><p data-el=\"text\">In the book, she also offers praise for former 2020 competitor Biden, describing him as a &#34;steady, decent man,&#34; as well as Independent Sen. Bernie Sanders of Vermont, whom she describes as &#34;fearless and determined.&#34;</p></section><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/elizabeth-warren-examination-2020-presidential-campaign-book-2021-5'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=ey2VNFxRezU:2T2B4FyJK44:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=ey2VNFxRezU:2T2B4FyJK44:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ey2VNFxRezU:2T2B4FyJK44:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=ey2VNFxRezU:2T2B4FyJK44:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ey2VNFxRezU:2T2B4FyJK44:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=ey2VNFxRezU:2T2B4FyJK44:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=ey2VNFxRezU:2T2B4FyJK44:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ey2VNFxRezU:2T2B4FyJK44:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/ey2VNFxRezU\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 02 May 2021 16:16:09 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/608ec0c134af8d001859a77f?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"22746bde9cd05fb71061d3c88c518265","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn69@2020_3/2021/05/03/03-57-21-654_4b1a052b0ca6c361.webp","destWidth":4444,"destHeight":3333,"sourceBytes":471776,"destBytes":471776,"author":"insider@insider.com (John L. Dorman)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/608ec508f22c6b00185db2a4?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn31@2020_6/2021/05/03/03-57-27-424_ecdc37874f4b8da9.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn24@2020_5/2021/05/03/03-57-26-516_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ey2VNFxRezU:2T2B4FyJK44:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn35@2020_5/2021/05/03/03-57-23-329_fd1642dfe7dfb862.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ey2VNFxRezU:2T2B4FyJK44:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn28@2020_4/2021/05/03/03-57-24-366_a32db74dfa06d9ed.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn68@2020_4/2021/05/03/03-57-24-468_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ey2VNFxRezU:2T2B4FyJK44:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn83@2020_4/2021/05/03/03-57-27-467_b31bc19fc2d0e0af.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/ey2VNFxRezU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn9@2020_1/2021/05/03/03-57-23-549_4949102227a0e505.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1620014238428},{"createdTime":"2021-05-03 11:57:18","updatedTime":"2021-05-03 11:57:18","title":"The end of pandemic-related lockdown is bringing a wave of cocaine to Puerto Rico","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/end-of-pandemic-lockdown-wave-of-cocaine-to-puerto-rico-2021-5","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608ec73534af8d001859a788?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Coast Guard Caribbean cocaine Puerto Rico\" height=\"998\" width=\"1997\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Coast Guard cutter Heriberto Hernandez crew members offload over 200 kilograms of cocaine, valued at over $5.6 million, at Coast Guard Base San Juan, March 2, 2021.\n<p class=\"copyright\">US Coast Guard</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>A surge in cocaine seizures indicates that routes through Puerto Rico are reactivating after pandemic-related dormancy.</li>\n<li>Puerto Rico has strategic value for traffickers moving drugs to the US because of its status as a US territory.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Puerto Rico is seeing a surge in cocaine seizures, indicating that drug flows are being reactivated after months of dormancy amid pandemic lockdowns and that the island is on track to tally a record drug haul in 2021.</p><p>The latest seizure occurred on April 17, when the United States Coast Guard intercepted a speedboat traveling along the coast of Aguadilla that was carrying 400 kilograms of cocaine, <a href=\"https://www.elnuevodia.com/noticias/seguridad/notas/la-guardia-costera-incauta-un-cargamento-de-cocaina-valorado-en-casi-20-millones/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">El Nuevo Día reported</a>.</p><p>According to Puerto Rican authorities, the total amount of <a href=\"https://www.elnuevodia.com/noticias/seguridad/notas/la-policia-sobre-el-aumento-en-confiscaciones-de-cocaina-estan-buscando-formas-de-poder-introducir-la-droga/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">cocaine seized</a> was up by nearly half year-on-year through March and 64% through mid-April.</p><p>On April 8, Puerto Rico tallied a record cocaine haul, <a href=\"https://news.yahoo.com/puerto-rico-police-seize-record-174902346.html?guccounter=1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">according to the Associated Press</a>. Puerto Rican Police Commissioner Antonio López reported the seizure of <a href=\"https://www.elnuevodia.com/noticias/seguridad/notas/la-policia-sobre-el-aumento-en-confiscaciones-de-cocaina-estan-buscando-formas-de-poder-introducir-la-droga/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">2.4 tons</a>, valued at $50 million. López explained that the drugs were being transported in speedboats off the southeastern town of Yabucoa.</p><p>One month beforehand, US Customs and Border Protection (CBP) <a href=\"https://www.cbp.gov/newsroom/local-media-release/us-border-patrol-assists-seizure-4269-pounds-cocaine-arrests-2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">reported</a> the seizure of almost two tons of cocaine, also in Yabucoa.</p><p>According to InSight Crime&#39;s press monitoring, around six tons of cocaine have been seized from January to late April along the island&#39;s Caribbean Coast. This compares to <a href=\"https://www.elnuevodia.com/english/news/story/a-blow-to-drug-trafficking/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">15.6 tons</a> for 2019, already one of the highest totals on record, <a href=\"https://dataunodc.un.org/data/drugs/Annual%20Drug%20Seizures\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">according to data</a> from the United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC).</p><p>In its most recent <a href=\"https://www.dea.gov/sites/default/files/2021-02/DIR-008-21%202020%20National%20Drug%20Threat%20Assessment_WEB.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">National Drug Threat Assessment</a>, the US Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) mentioned that Puerto Rico is used as a transit point by Dominican, Colombian and Venezuelan drug traffickers, as well as Mexico&#39;s Jalisco Cartel New Generation (Cartel Jalisco Nueva Generación - CJNG).</p><p>The island offers strategic value for traffickers moving drugs to the United States due to its status as a US territory. Once the drug shipments enter Puerto Rico, they are more easily transported to the continental United States, as Puerto Ricans can transit freely and do not have to go through customs controls.</p><h2 id=\"h-insight-crime-analysis\">InSight Crime analysis</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608ec72c34af8d001859a787?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Coast Guard Caribbean cocaine Puerto Rico\" height=\"1460\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Coast Guard crew members offload 302 kilograms of cocaine valued at $8.5 million in San Juan, Puerto Rico, January 28, 2021.\n<p class=\"copyright\">US Coast Guard</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Puerto Rican authorities believe that the spike in cocaine transiting the island is due to the months of restrictions on transit amid the pandemic, the testing of new trafficking routes and the backlog of accumulated drugs.</p><p>&#34;[Due to the confinement], drug traffickers had difficulties in moving merchandise. The consequence may have been that the drugs accumulated and they are looking for ways to enter the drugs,&#34; Lt. Felícita Coreano, director of the Puerto Rico&#39;s United Rapid Action Force (Fuerzas Unidas de Rápida Acción - FURA), <a href=\"https://www.elnuevodia.com/noticias/seguridad/notas/la-policia-sobre-el-aumento-en-confiscaciones-de-cocaina-estan-buscando-formas-de-poder-introducir-la-droga/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">told</a> El Nuevo Día.</p><p>According to the <a href=\"https://www.dea.gov/sites/default/files/2021-02/DIR-008-21%202020%20National%20Drug%20Threat%20Assessment_WEB.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">DEA</a>, cocaine shipments enter Puerto Rico almost entirely by sea. The shipments are mostly sent by speedboats and fishing vessels <a href=\"https://dataunodc.un.org/data/drugs/Annual%20Drug%20Seizures\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">from Colombia</a> and Venezuela. These boats usually make a stop in the Dominican Republic, where the drugs are collected by criminal networks who then move them to other destinations, including Puerto Rico.</p><p>However, in its latest report, the DEA warned of a new speedboat route directly connecting Venezuela to Puerto Rico and bypassing the Dominican Republic. This route could be behind the increasingly large shipments found in the US territory.</p><p>&#34;[The drug traffickers] are looking to expand and find new shipping routes,&#34; Habib Massari, a drug policy expert in Puerto Rico, told El Nuevo Día.</p><p>Investigations conducted by InSight Crime in the Caribbean indicate that a number of criminal networks in Puerto Rico provide logistical services for international traffickers, especially Dominican groups.</p><p>Dominican groups are responsible for coordinating drug shipments from Puerto Rico to the United States ­- particularly to northeastern states - via shipping containers, <a href=\"https://insightcrime.org/news/brief/transnational-criminal-group-postal-service-traffic-drugs/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">messenger services</a>, <a href=\"http://www.primeraplanany.com/internacionales/america-latina/rep-dominicana/el-empresario-patin-enfrenta-el-mayor-caso-de-droga-de-rd-dice-investigador/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">private planes</a> and &#34;<a href=\"https://insightcrime.org/news/brief/airport-cocaine-trafficking-network-points-puerto-rico-role-transit-point/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">mules</a>.&#34;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/end-of-pandemic-lockdown-wave-of-cocaine-to-puerto-rico-2021-5'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a Held)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/608ec73534af8d001859a788?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn17@2020_6/2021/05/03/03-57-23-682_c90060dc7d81e0c5.webp","https://i.insider.com/608ec72c34af8d001859a787?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn26@2020_3/2021/05/03/03-57-27-773_d674b5a48aad4483.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn24@2020_5/2021/05/03/03-57-26-516_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=7VDSyiteSGI:tXq0b8kTIW4:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn9@2020_2/2021/05/03/03-57-25-975_f567ca3019be895d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=7VDSyiteSGI:tXq0b8kTIW4:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn87@2020_5/2021/05/03/03-57-26-712_e85e0ca5d83b10fe.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn68@2020_4/2021/05/03/03-57-24-468_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=7VDSyiteSGI:tXq0b8kTIW4:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn39@2020_3/2021/05/03/03-57-24-119_82279a8938e8c6c3.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/7VDSyiteSGI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn77@2020_2/2021/05/03/03-57-22-119_2788877d8df3ca8e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1620014238428},{"createdTime":"2021-05-03 11:57:18","updatedTime":"2021-05-03 11:57:18","title":"Kamala Harris will be the first vice president with a wax figure at Madame Tussauds","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/kamala-harris-wax-figure-madame-tussauds-first-vp-2021-5","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608ea7c1f22c6b00185db27f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Harris with Studio Artist\" height=\"1753\" width=\"3508\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Kamala Harris&#39; bust at the Madame Tussauds Wax Museum in New York City.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Madame Tussauds</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Madame Tussauds is set to unveil a life-size wax figure statue of Vice President Kamala Harris.</li>\n<li>With the debut, Harris will become the first vice president to be immortalized in the famous New York City museum.</li>\n<li>President Joe Biden will also have a statue dedicated to his likeness. </li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Vice President Kamala Harris will be immortalized in Madame Tussauds wax museum in New York City.</p><p>She will become the first vice president to have a wax figure dedicated to her likeness at the museum. </p><p>Both she and President Joe Biden will have wax figures unveiled later this year, and each will be displayed in the museum&#39;s &#34;Oval Office experience,&#34; according to the museum.</p><p>The clay heads took weeks for a team of London artists to sculpt, <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/pg/nycwax/posts/?ref=page_internal\">the museum said on Facebook.</a> The museum estimates the bodies will take about four to six months to complete. </p><p>&#34;I feel like the most important features of Kamala Harris to get right are not only her lovely, warm and welcoming smile but also her eyes because I feel like she&#39;s so engaging when she smiles, she actually smiles with her eyes as well,&#34; <a href=\"https://twitter.com/TussaudsUSA/status/1387466297450041359\">sculptor Vicky Grant said in a video posted on Twitter</a>. </p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608ea2fdf22c6b00185db27a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Biden &#38; Harris with Studio Artists\" height=\"2063\" width=\"3508\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The busts of both Biden and Harris, alongside their sculptors for Madame Tussauds.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Madame Tussauds</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The wax figures of both Biden and Harris will wear the same outfits each wore on Inauguration Day this year, NBC News <a href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/kamala-harris-be-first-vice-president-immortalized-madame-tussauds-wax-n1266067\">reported</a>. </p><p>Christopher John Rogers, the designer who put together Harris&#39; outfit for her swearing-in ceremony will design Harris&#39; wax figure&#39;s outfit, according to NBC News. </p><p>&#34;We&#39;re honored to create a figure for Vice President Harris and reflect this significant moment in US history for guests inside Madame Tussauds New York,&#34; Brittany Williams, spokesperson for Madame Tussauds, told the outlet. </p><p> </p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/kamala-harris-wax-figure-madame-tussauds-first-vp-2021-5'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=SgGlbVJpgXU:dl9sMdrHmA8:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/SgGlbVJpgXU\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 02 May 2021 13:36:26 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/608e9e9bf22c6b00185db274?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"830ec4640da5a958c2f634aa49bb3a56","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn30@2020_3/2021/05/03/03-57-21-639_e9eabf4d51fe8a5e.webp","destWidth":3121,"destHeight":2340,"sourceBytes":142172,"destBytes":142172,"author":"ydzhanova@businessinsider.com (Yelena Dzhanova)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/608ea7c1f22c6b00185db27f?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn65@2020_5/2021/05/03/03-57-22-281_f3e493c8634fa4e0.webp","https://i.insider.com/608ea2fdf22c6b00185db27a?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn52@2020_6/2021/05/03/03-57-30-885_cc663ed95ccb3049.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn24@2020_5/2021/05/03/03-57-26-516_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=SgGlbVJpgXU:dl9sMdrHmA8:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn24@2020_5/2021/05/03/03-57-24-377_e78b8dd1068c1184.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=SgGlbVJpgXU:dl9sMdrHmA8:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn69@2020_2/2021/05/03/03-57-26-719_e17a70afba3fb77a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn68@2020_4/2021/05/03/03-57-24-468_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=SgGlbVJpgXU:dl9sMdrHmA8:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn68@2020_2/2021/05/03/03-57-22-749_076bbbc61d06b521.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/SgGlbVJpgXU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn78@2020_5/2021/05/03/03-57-23-436_56f82e3f103999d8.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1620014238431},{"createdTime":"2021-05-03 11:57:18","updatedTime":"2021-05-03 11:57:18","title":"Liz Cheney is facing mounting criticism from her GOP colleagues","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/liz-cheney-criticism-republican-party-conservatives-trump-2021-5","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608ed37f34af8d001859a78d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Liz Cheney\" height=\"2000\" width=\"4000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>House Republican Conference Chair Liz Cheney is the highest-ranking female Republican in Congress.\n<p class=\"copyright\">AP Photo/J. Scott Applewhite</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>House Republican Conference Chair Liz Cheney is the highest-ranking female Republican in Congress.</li>\n<li>After she publicly fist-bumped Biden and continued to criticize Trump, some want her out of leadership.</li>\n<li>Cheney is a veteran of Republican politics, but today&#39;s GOP differs greatly from even 5 years ago.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>For years, GOP Rep. Liz Cheney of Wyoming has been seen as a rising star within the party, a straight-talking conservative woman from a dynastic Republican family who ascended to House leadership only two years after her first congressional race.</p><p>Cheney was first elected to office on the same day that former President Donald Trump was voted into the White House in 2016.</p><p>However, over four years later, their paths have sharply diverged.</p><p>In February, Cheney, the No. 3 House Republican, was one of only 10 House Republicans <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/republicans-voting-to-impeach-trump-capitol-insurrection-2021-1\">who voted</a> to impeach Trump for <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-biden-electoral-college-loss-violence-presidential-election-extremism-2021-1\">his role</a> in the January 6 Capitol riot.</p><p>Unlike most members of her party, Cheney has been unusually candid in her criticism of Trump, especially as it relates to the damage that she feels the former president caused to the democratic process and the peaceful transfer of power.</p><p>&#34;What we saw, first hand, on Jan. 6 was a threat to this system,&#34; she said during a February foreign policy event sponsored by the Ronald Reagan Presidential Foundation and Institute. &#34;What happened on that day must never happen again.&#34;</p><p>Trump, even in defeat, still holds an iron grip over most of the party, and he has zeroed in on ensuring Cheney&#39;s political defeat.</p><p>During his keynote speech at February&#39;s Conservative Political Action Conference (CPAC) in Florida, the former president <a href=\"https://twitter.com/forbes/status/1366203270700613634\">called out</a> Cheney as a &#34;warmonger,&#34; with the mention of her name resulting in a chorus of boos.</p><p>&#34;The good news is in her state, she&#39;s been censured and in her state her poll numbers have dropped faster than any human being I&#39;ve ever seen,&#34; he said at the time. &#34;So hopefully they&#39;ll get rid of her with the next election.&#34;</p><p>In February, Cheney faced a mutiny from some of the most conservative elements of the party after her vote to impeach Trump, but the GOP caucus <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/liz-cheney-holds-on-to-leadership-position-following-gop-vote-2021-2\">kept her in leadership</a> in a 145-61 vote.</p><p>However, the past few weeks have seen a cascade of developments that seriously imperil Cheney&#39;s leadership role - and her future within the party - a stunning reversal for a candidate who in the past has been touted as a potential House speaker, US senator, or president.</p><h2>Trump continues to dominate GOP politics</h2><p>During the party&#39;s House legislative retreat in Florida last week, the schism between Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy and Cheney was increasingly apparent.</p><p>McCarthy, who in February publicly <a href=\"https://www.axios.com/mccarthy-cheney-support-marjorie-taylor-greene-committees-5c53efc8-7c6b-44b9-bdf0-0b525aa4de27.html\">backed</a> Cheney remaining in leadership, wouldn&#39;t say if she should remain in her role when asked if she was still a &#34;good fit.&#34;</p><p data-paragraph-id=\"paragraph_D6189C23-5137-210F-65E8-143778CB6BD1\" data-act-id=\"paragraph_0\">&#34;That&#39;s a question for the conference,&#34; he said.</p><p data-paragraph-id=\"paragraph_D6189C23-5137-210F-65E8-143778CB6BD1\" data-act-id=\"paragraph_0\"><a href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/2021/04/26/mccarthy-cheney-gop-484756\">In an interview with Politico</a> last week, the California Republican also chided Cheney for her continued criticism of Trump.</p><p data-paragraph-id=\"paragraph_D6189C23-5137-210F-65E8-143778CB6BD1\" data-act-id=\"paragraph_0\">&#34;There&#39;s a responsibility, if you&#39;re gonna be in leadership, leaders eat<strong> </strong>last,&#34; he said. &#34;And when leaders try to go out, and not work as one team, it creates difficulties.&#34;</p><p data-paragraph-id=\"paragraph_D6189C23-5137-210F-65E8-143778CB6BD1\" data-act-id=\"paragraph_0\"></p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608eb653f22c6b00185db293?format=jpeg\" alt=\"President Joe Biden (C) greets Rep. Liz Cheney (R-WY) with a fist bump before addressing a joint session of congress in the House chamber of the US Capitol April 28, 2021 in Washington, DC.\" height=\"640\" width=\"1280\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>President Joe Biden (C) greets Rep. Liz Cheney (R-WY) with a fist bump before addressing a joint session of congress in the House chamber of the US Capitol April 28, 2021 in Washington, DC.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong><em>Read more: </em></strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/peter-meijer-trump-impeachment-michigan-house-republican-profile-2021-4\"><em>This millennial GOP congressman voted to impeach Trump. Now he&#39;s trying to save his party from going off a cliff.</em></a></p><p data-paragraph-id=\"paragraph_D6189C23-5137-210F-65E8-143778CB6BD1\" data-act-id=\"paragraph_0\">Last Wednesday, Cheney gave a fist bump to President Joe Biden before his first address to a joint session of Congress, sending partisans into a tizzy.</p><p data-paragraph-id=\"paragraph_D6189C23-5137-210F-65E8-143778CB6BD1\" data-act-id=\"paragraph_0\">Responding to attacks from the party&#39;s right flank, Cheney <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/liz-cheney-defends-fist-bumping-biden-donald-trump-jr-attack-2021-4\">reaffirmed</a> her conservatism while calling for a need to be conciliatory to people with opposing views.</p><p data-paragraph-id=\"paragraph_D6189C23-5137-210F-65E8-143778CB6BD1\" data-act-id=\"paragraph_0\">&#34;I disagree strongly w/@JoeBiden policies, but when the President reaches out to greet me in the chamber of the US House of Representatives, I will always respond in a civil, respectful &#38; dignified way,&#34; Cheney <a href=\"https://twitter.com/Liz_Cheney/status/1387921478889394183\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"60\" data-uri=\"5d5e29be4782a60631dcc33b7f36d2ec\">tweeted</a> on Thursday. &#34;We&#39;re different political parties. We&#39;re not sworn enemies. We&#39;re Americans.&#34;</p><p data-paragraph-id=\"paragraph_D6189C23-5137-210F-65E8-143778CB6BD1\" data-act-id=\"paragraph_0\">Last week, she also <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/rep-liz-cheney-leaves-open-option-of-presidential-run-2021-4\">floated</a> a possible presidential campaign while also <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/kevin-mccarthy-liz-cheney-house-republican-conference-leadership-2021-4\">saying</a> that McCarthy and Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell of Kentucky were the leaders of the GOP - leaving out Trump.</p><h2>&#34;She is alienating herself from the conference&#34;</h2><p>Cheney&#39;s opinions have infuriated conservatives who feel that she isn&#39;t projecting a unified front against Democrats - with many hoping to oust her from leadership.</p><p>&#34;It&#39;s at a boiling point,&#34; <a href=\"https://thehill.com/homenews/house/551261-gop-frustration-with-liz-cheney-at-a-boiling-point?rl=1\">said</a> one GOP lawmaker to The Hill. &#34;This isn&#39;t about Liz Cheney wanting to impeach Donald Trump; this isn&#39;t about Donald Trump at all. It&#39;s about Liz Cheney being completely out of synch with the majority of our conference.&#34;</p><p>The legislator told The Hill that Cheney&#39;s actions were becoming the subject of text conversations among House GOP colleagues.</p><p>&#34;As we&#39;re focused on unifying the Republican conference and our mission to win back the majority, she is focused on the past and proving a point,&#34; the lawmaker told The Hill. &#34;She is alienating herself from the conference, and I have to imagine if she doesn&#39;t resign there will be a new vote in the near future and the result will be lopsided in the opposite direction of what it was before.&#34;</p><p>GOP Rep. Jim Banks of Indiana, chairman of the conservative Republican Study Committee, <a href=\"https://www.axios.com/gop-leaders-cheney-ouster-fc28f6c2-507e-4a69-b4c4-6af95cc734fc.html\">told Axios</a> last Friday that Cheney&#39;s comments were &#34;an unwelcome distraction&#34; and openly questioned whether she would still be on the leadership team in the coming weeks.</p><p>On Saturday, GOP Rep. Lance Gooden of Texas <a href=\"https://twitter.com/Lancegooden/status/1388539738328547328\">predicted</a> that Cheney would be out of leadership by the end of the month.</p><p>&#34;Liz Cheney has promised she will campaign on impeaching Trump &#39;every day of the week,&#39;&#34; he tweeted. &#34;Good luck with that, Liz! PREDICTION: she&#39;ll be out of her GOP leadership role by month&#39;s end!&#34;</p><h2>Cheney is navigating a different GOP than the one she once knew</h2><p>Cheney is well-versed in the ways of Republican politics in Washington, DC.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608eb66f34af8d001859a771?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Liz Cheney Dick Cheney\" height=\"1500\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Then-Vice President Dick Cheney and Liz Cheney watch the inaugural parade from the Presidential reviewing stand in front of the White House on January 20, 2005.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jamie Squire/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Her father, former Vice President Dick Cheney, is a former congressman from Wyoming who also served as House Republican Conference Chair before becoming House Minority Whip and then Secretary of Defense.</p><p>A graduate of Colorado College and the University of Chicago Law School, the congresswoman practiced law before embarking on a career with the State Department, serving as Deputy Assistant Secretary of State for Near Eastern Affairs and Principal Deputy Assistant Secretary of State for Near Eastern Affairs under then-President George W. Bush.</p><p>She has long been a defense hawk, a position in line with many Republicans from the second Bush administration.</p><p>However, in a Trump-dominated GOP, Cheney is encountering forces that are different than anything she&#39;s had to deal with in the past. Simply having conservative credentials isn&#39;t enough anymore.</p><h2>Cheney still has her boosters within the caucus</h2><p>Cheney is not without her allies, though, as they delivered votes for her in the leadership secret ballot earlier this year.</p><p>GOP Rep. Anthony Gonzalez of Ohio, who also voted to impeach Trump for his role in the Capitol riot, emphasized that Cheney was one of the few Republicans willing to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-fox-interview-bartiromo-debunked-fraud-allegations-election-2020-11\">call out</a> the former president&#39;s debunked election claims.</p><p>&#34;If a prerequisite for leading our conference is continuing to lie to our voters, then Liz is not the best fit,&#34; he told The Hill. &#34;Liz isn&#39;t going to lie to people. Liz is going to say what she believes. She&#39;s going to stand on principle. If that&#39;s going to be distracting for folks, she&#39;s not the best fit. I wish that weren&#39;t the case.&#34;</p><p>Gonzalez told The Hill he would back Cheney if a second leadership vote is held.</p><p>As the GOP tries to combat its electoral difficulties with suburban women and minority voters, another Cheney ally told The Hill that her presence lends the argument that the party is welcoming to all.</p><p>&#34;Does Cheney&#39;s stubborn insistence to stick with her conviction rub some of us wrong? Yes. But I sure wish McCarthy realizes that it benefits us in the long run if we have one member of our leadership team who won&#39;t kiss Trump&#39;s ass,&#34; the Cheney ally said. &#34;It&#39;s good for the Republican party.&#34;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/4VUMPM4P9zk\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 02 May 2021 19:47:01 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/608e9caa34af8d001859a74e?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"c12074578e598e307786b00934acabbe","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn49@2020_4/2021/05/03/03-57-21-709_34643e0e60a8f027.webp","destWidth":3556,"destHeight":2666,"sourceBytes":528782,"destBytes":528782,"author":"insider@insider.com (John L. Dorman)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/608ed37f34af8d001859a78d?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn9@2020_6/2021/05/03/03-57-25-096_8a57b1dfb7c45f88.webp","https://i.insider.com/608eb653f22c6b00185db293?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn71@2020_6/2021/05/03/03-57-25-371_0a0c08b41c930fed.webp","https://i.insider.com/608eb66f34af8d001859a771?format=jpeg":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn24@2020_5/2021/05/03/03-57-26-516_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=4VUMPM4P9zk:7BLtxxaFm4E:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn79@2020_1/2021/05/03/03-57-27-409_013482e8fb41fc29.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=4VUMPM4P9zk:7BLtxxaFm4E:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn37@2020_3/2021/05/03/03-57-22-656_74c9b95137beb98e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn68@2020_4/2021/05/03/03-57-24-468_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=4VUMPM4P9zk:7BLtxxaFm4E:gIN9vFwOqvQ":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/4VUMPM4P9zk":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn21@2020_4/2021/05/03/03-57-25-591_93b307c3b38e1a04.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1620014238426},{"createdTime":"2021-05-03 11:57:18","updatedTime":"2021-05-03 11:57:18","title":"The US is still waiting on its first bitcoin ETF. Here's what experts say the SEC wants to see before giving approval.","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/bitcoin-etf-sec-approval-us-launch-volatility-market-gensler-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/600f279767a6bc0019d9ae34?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Bitcoin.\" height=\"2002\" width=\"4005\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The SEC has a number of applications for bitcoin ETFs to review.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/news-photo/in-this-photo-illustration-a-nitizen-holds-two-news-photo/1230435384?adppopup=true\" target=\"_blank\">NurPhoto/Getty Images</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>The SEC has started reviewing applications for bitcoin exchange-traded funds, which have yet to launch for trading in the US. </li>\n<li>The regulator will consider bitcoin&#39;s volatility and market maturity in rendering a decision whether or not to greenlight the products, experts say. </li>\n<li>The SEC recently pushed back a decision on a bitcoin ETF until at least this summer. </li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Bitcoin&#39;s fast-growing popularity, increasingly elevated profile in corporate America and swelling <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/currencies/news/bitcoin-trillion-market-cap-milestone-faster-amazon-apple-microsoft-google-2021-4-1030302376\">market capitalization above $1 trillion</a> have retail and Wall Street investors alike questioning if and when a bitcoin exchange-traded fund can be traded in the US. Those questions are currently before the Securities and Exchange Commission which is being asked in <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/currencies/news/bitcoin-etf-approval-mike-novogratz-galaxy-digital-sec-crypto-regulation-2021-4-1030298912\">at least nine applications</a> for the green light to launch what could be the first cryptocurrency ETF in the country. <br><br>But a decision may have to wait at least until mid-June. The SEC this week <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/currencies/news/sec-bitcoin-etf-vaneck-june-decision-application-cryptocurrency-listing-cboe-2021-4-1030359563\">delayed rendering a decision</a> on a bitcoin ETF from asset manager VanEck that, if cleared, would be <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/currencies/news/bitcoin-etf-btc-van-eck-cboe-files-for-approval-sec-2021-3-1030141735?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestgest\">listed by CBOE Global Markets</a>. The Commission <a href=\"https://www.sec.gov/rules/sro/cboebzx/2021/34-91695.pdf\">said it was &#34;appropriate&#34;</a> to take more time for consideration. <br><br>The arrival of a bitcoin ETF in 2021 would follow this month&#39;s start of trading in shares of <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/coin-stock\">Coinbase</a>, the first cryptocurrency exchange to go public, as well as expanding acceptance of bitcoin as payment methods by companies including <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/elon-musk-tweets-you-can-buy-a-tesla-with-bitcoin-2021-3?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestgest\">electric vehicle maker Tesla</a>. Meanwhile, investment bank JP Morgan is preparing to introduce its first <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/currencies/news/jpmorgan-bitcoin-fund-wealthy-clients-access-summer-actively-managed-crypto-2021-4-1030346164\">bitcoin fund for wealthy clients.</a></p><p>These and other bitcoin developments may signal the increased likelihood that a bitcoin ETF will gain approval, but the SEC <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/currencies/news/bitcoin-etf-crypto-commissioner-sec-refusal-has-created-a-challenge-2021-3-1030224597\">has rejected other attempts</a>.</p><p>Institutions &#34;are getting in from hedge funds on Wall Street to PayPal, to Venmo, to Visa. So [the SEC] can&#39;t really ignore this because the market is deciding that they want to be involved,&#34; Ian Balina, founder and CEO of Token Metrics, a data-driven cryptocurrency investment research platform, told Insider. </p><p>Here are three hurdles and tailwinds that experts say stand in front of the first US bitcoin ETF:</p><p><strong>1) Bitcoin volatility</strong></p><p>The world&#39;s most widely traded digital asset is well-known for its wild price swings, with gains or losses of 10% during a session not uncommon.</p><p>&#34;The SEC has a difficult job balancing the clearly overwhelming desire for the market to have access to BTC via an ETF versus the inherent volatility that the asset class has at this stage in its life cycle,&#34; George McDonaugh, co-founder of digital asset investment firm KR1, told Insider.  &#34;Volatility would be one of the major considerations. Bitcoin is very scarce and comparatively still a very young asset class. The volatility should dampen over time but that might be long after the market loses patience waiting for [a bitcoin ETF].&#34;</p><p>Price volatility has declined in recent weeks and such moves make <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/currencies/news/bitcoin-price-outlook-volatility-attractive-institutions-supports-price-target-jpmorgan-2021-4-1030270274?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestgest\">bitcoin more appealing to institutions, according to JPMorgan</a>. </p><p>Liquidity in the bitcoin market had also been a factor under consideration by the SEC. <br><br>&#34;I think it&#39;s less of a concern now [than] in the early days … and a lot of that is tied to institutional players coming into and creating depth and breadth in the market,&#34; Matteo Dante Perruccio, president international of Wave Financial, a US-regulated digital asset manager, told Insider. &#34;If it&#39;s 90% retail investors in an asset and you open it up to a bigger universe of retail investors, I think that&#39;s a really hard decision to make as a regulator. But it helps you have substantive institutional investors trading and involved in investing in it.&#34;</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/binance-ceo-interview-profile-how-he-built-largest-crypto-exchange-2021-5\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao breaks down how he built the world&#39;s largest crypto exchange in 180 days - and shares why he&#39;s keeping most of his assets in Bitcoin and Binance Coin</a></em></p><p><strong>2) Market maturity</strong> <br><br>&#34;It&#39;s fair to say if you look at the denials for the last several ETFs, you can see that there was concern among several of the commissioners that the bitcoin market was not sufficiently regulated and, in their view, was susceptible to manipulation,&#34; and &#34;when I say that I mean that manipulation would show up in prices,&#34; Amy Doberman, a partner in the securities department at law firm WilmerHale, told Insider. <br><br>&#34;I think what you&#39;re going to see with the pending requests for approval is an argument that the market is far more developed than it was four or five years ago and that there&#39;s a lot more price discovery available than there was even just a few years ago so that there will be the ability to reference actual trades and sufficient information to develop accurate prices,&#34; said Doberman.</p><p><strong>3) What&#39;s on the SEC&#39;s plate </strong></p><p>The US lags behind other countries in approving bitcoin ETFs, with <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/currencies/news/canada-approves-first-bitcoin-etf-btc-hopes-sec-us-cryptocurrency-2021-2-1030078644\">Canada this year approving</a> the first publicly traded bitcoin ETF in North America, the Purpose Bitcoin ETF, as well as ethereum ETFs. Brazilian regulators have reportedly <a href=\"https://cointelegraph.com/news/brazilian-stock-exchange-approves-two-new-crypto-etfs-in-latin-america\">approved two bitcoin ETFs</a>. </p><p>&#34;People underestimate the Canadian approval,&#34; said Wave Financial&#39;s Perruccio, characterizing as &#34;close cousins&#34; the SEC&#39;s relationship with the Canadian securities regulator. &#34;The regulators have got to be talking a lot and ... you always feel more comfortable in company when you are making these bold decisions,&#34; and Canada&#39;s regulator is considered as well-respected, he said. For a US bitcoin ETF, &#34;I feel like it&#39;s inevitable. It&#39;s no longer &#39;if&#39; but &#39;when&#39; and I think the question of when is probably in 2021. That&#39;s my prediction,&#34; said Perruccio.</p><p>While bitcoin ETF applications pile up, the SEC and its new chairman Gary Gensler have a range of other issues they are working on. Gensler, who was confirmed as chairman earlier this month, is seen by some bitcoin ETF proponents as a cryptocurrency advocate stemming in part from his teachings at MIT on the subject.</p><p>Gensler &#34;will have to decide what he wants to prioritize,&#34; said Doberman. He&#39;s &#34;obviously very knowledgeable about cryptocurrencies and hopefully will bring an additional level of sophistication and appreciation for the currency to the table,&#34; she said.</p><p>During his confirmation hearing, Gensler said the SEC under his watch would review issues surrounding <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/sec-nominee-gensler-gamestop-reddit-payment-order-flow-robinhood-trading-2021-3-1030142124\">protection and fairness for retail investors</a> in the backdrop of &#34;gamification&#34; on trading apps and platforms. </p><p>The agency is reportedly considering stricter rules to rein in <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/sec-spac-growth-projections-ipo-regulation-crackdown-rein-blank-check-2021-4-1030359061\">projections made by special purpose acquisition companies, or SPACs,</a> and reportedly has opened a preliminary investigation into leveraged trades at the Archegos Capital Management <a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-03-31/sec-opens-investigation-into-archegos-trades-that-sparked-rout?sref=GUP2BhaG\">hedge fund that collapsed in March</a>.</p><p>While he&#39;s well-versed in the subject of cryptocurrencies, Gensler, who served as a chairman of the Commodity Futures Trading Commission under the Obama administration, will not just wave through bitcoin ETFs applications without scrutiny, said Noah Hamman, CEO of AdvisorShares, a firm that offers actively managed exchange-traded funds through its AdvisorShares Trust.</p><p>Gensler will be in the role &#34;of looking at the rules and regs and deciding if either, one, something fits or two, do the rules and regs need to be modified to allow it to fit because it makes sense and it&#39;s the right thing to do,&#34; said Hamman. AdvisorShares does not have a bitcoin ETF filing with the SEC.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/bitcoin-etf-sec-approval-us-launch-volatility-market-gensler-2021-4'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=TAAwhaW9WE0:XiGshrth5Og:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=TAAwhaW9WE0:XiGshrth5Og:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=TAAwhaW9WE0:XiGshrth5Og:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a
